Class DataProvider

java.lang.Object
musicApp.utils.DataProvider
public class DataProvider extends Object
This class is responsible for reading and writing the settings of the application. The settings are stored in: - Mac: ~/Library/Application Support/musicapp - Windows: %APPDATA%/musicapp - Linux: ~/.config/musicapp

The settings are stored in the following format: balance=0.0 musicFolder=/path/to/music/folder

The default music folder is the user's music folder. If the settings file does not exist, it will be created with the default settings.

    • getDefaultMusicFolder

      public Path getDefaultMusicFolder()
      Returns the default music directory based on the operating system. If the default music directory does not exist, it will be created.
      Returns:
      The default music directory.

    • writeSettings

      public void writeSettings(Settings settings)
      Writes the settings to the settings file.
      Parameters:
      settings - The settings to write.

    • readSettings

      public Settings readSettings()
      Reads the settings from the settings file. If the settings file does not exist, it will be created with the default settings.
      Returns:
      The settings read from the settings file.

    • getSettings

      protected Settings getSettings(Path path)

    • readPlaylists

      public List<Library> readPlaylists() throws IllegalArgumentException
      Reads the playlists from the playlists file. If the playlists file does not exist, it will be created with an empty list of playlists.
      Returns:
      The playlists read from the playlists file.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an error occurs while reading the playlists file.

    • getPlaylists

      protected List<Library> getPlaylists(Path path) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Reads the playlists from the given path. Mainly kept in protected scope for testing purposes.
      Parameters:
      path - The path to read the playlists from.
      Returns:
      The playlists read from the given path.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - If an error occurs while reading the playlists from the given path.

    • writePlaylists

      public void writePlaylists(List<Library> playlists)
      Writes the playlists to the playlists file.
      Parameters:
      playlists - The playlists to write.

      Parameters:

      Throws:

    • getLyricsDir

      public Path getLyricsDir()

    • getLyricsPath

      public String getLyricsPath(String pathSong)
      Returns the path of the lyrics file for a given song. If the song is not found, returns null.
      Parameters:
      pathSong - The path of the song.
      Returns:
      The path of the lyrics file or null if not found.

    • updateLyricsMapping

      public void updateLyricsMapping(String pathSong, String pathLyrics)
      Updates the lyrics mapping for a song. If the song is not found, it will be added to the library.
      Parameters:
      pathSong - The path of the song.
      pathLyrics - The path of the lyrics.

    • readLyricsLibrary

      private LyricsLibrary readLyricsLibrary()
      Reads the lyrics library from the lyrics file. If the lyrics file does not exist, it will be created with an empty library.
      Returns:
      The lyrics library read from the lyrics file.

    • writeLyricsLibrary

      private void writeLyricsLibrary(LyricsLibrary lib)
      Writes the lyrics library to the lyrics file.
      Parameters:
      lib - The lyrics library to write.
